tool.name: Nanopolish eventalign
tool.description: - Align nanopore events to reference k-mers
tool.command:
ln -s '$input_merged' reads.fasta &&
#if $input_reads_raw.extension == 'fast5': mkdir fast5_files && ln -s '$input_reads_raw' fast5_files/read1.fast5 && #else ln -s '$input_reads_raw' fast5_files.tar.gz && mkdir fast5_files && tar -xzf fast5_files.tar.gz -C fast5_files && #end if
nanopolish index -d fast5_files/ reads.fasta && ln -s '$b' reads.bam && ln -s '${b.metadata.bam_index}' reads.bam.bai && #if $reference_source.reference_source_selector == 'history': ln -f -s '$reference_source.ref_file' genome.fa && #else: ln -f -s '$reference_source.ref_file.fields.path' genome.fa && #end if
nanopolish eventalign -r reads.fasta -b reads.bam -g genome.fa #if str($min_mapping_quality): -q $min_mapping_quality #end if --threads "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" $samples $scale_events $sam $print_read_names #if $w and str($w).strip(): -w "${w}" #end if #if $input_models_fofn: --models-fofn '$input_models_fofn' #end if #if $summary: --summary eventalign-summary.txt #end if > eventalign.out

param.name: input_reads_raw
param.label: Flat archive file of raw fast5 files
Reads aligned to the reference genome

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: ref_file
param.label: Use the following dataset as the reference sequence
param.help: REFERENCE_SEQUENCE; You can upload a FASTA sequence to the history and use it as reference

param.label: find variants in window of region chromsome:start-end

param.name: min_mapping_quality
param.label: Only use reads with mapping quality of at least this value
Summarize the alignment of each read/strand
Write the raw samples for the event to the tsv output

param.name: scale_events
param.label: Scale events to the model, rather than vice-versa

param.name: print_read_names
param.label: Print read names instead of indexes

tool.help:
Usage: nanopolish eventalign [OPTIONS] --reads reads.fa --bam alignments.bam --genome genome.fa Align nanopore events to reference k-mers
Tutorial and manual available at: http://nanopolish.readthedocs.io/en/latest/quickstart_eventalign.html
